intro: Ageratum meridanum, commonly known as the Mexican mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features fluffy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its foliage is usually gray-green with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in full sun to partial shade. Ageratum meridanum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant blooms and ability to attract pollinators.
